result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Paul O'Connor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher Paul O'Connor is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christopher Paul O'Connor was found guilty of Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Comply with treatment.  Counts 2 and 3 dismissed.  14TR5697 dismissed.

miscConds.notes: The fine is $1694.00 payable to probation.
Must provide DNA sample and $250.00 DNA surcharge.
6 month periodic review.  Defendant to report to probation by 4pm today.

timeConds.notes: Huber privileges subject to jail policies.  May serve sentence in Outagamie County.  Good time allowed.  9-23-2015 Judge White suspends huber privileges 9-21-15 to 11-21-15 and imposed loss of 25 days good time.   11-6-15 Judge White reinstated huber privileges effective 11-9-15.  No good time.
